EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Don started cooking eggs for me.

Text_en: Like...
Text_ortho: Like...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The like...

Text_en: They gave me eggs, like eight eggs.
Text_ortho: Dem do egg for me like eight egg.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They made an egg for me like eight eggs.

Text_en: They gave me more, like three.
Text_ortho: Dem con do anoder one like three.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They did more than three more.

Text_en: It remains...
Text_ortho: E remain...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He remains...

Text_en: It laid ten eggs.
Text_ortho: E do ten.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He did ten things.

Text_en: This one, that's the one.
Text_ortho: Dis one be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This is that.

Text_en: Again, I was... little by little.
Text_ortho: Again, I dey small, small.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Again, I'm just a kid.

Text_en: I'm fine.
Text_ortho: I dey o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm fine.

Text_en: A dog that was in this house, it ate two of my turkeys.
Text_ortho: One dog wey dey dis house, e con chop my two turkey.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: There was a dog in this house, he ate my two turkeys.

Text_en: I was sleeping, then I started hearing them fight violently.
Text_ortho: I dey sleep, I con dey hear deir violence.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was sleeping and hearing their violence.

Text_en: I came outside.
Text_ortho: I con come out.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I came out.

Text_en: I saw the dog, it ran that way.
Text_ortho: I see di dog run go like dis.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I saw the dog running like this.

Text_en: I went after it but I did not catch it.
Text_ortho: I follow am, I no catch am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I followed him, I didn't catch him.

Text_en: The one it actually came to eat, I bought them for four thousand each.
Text_ortho: Di one wey kukuma e come chop, each one, I buy am four thousand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I got four thousand naira for one kukuma to eat.

Text_en: The male... the male, I bought it for seven thousand.
Text_ortho: Di man, di man I buy am seven thousand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The man... the man I bought for seven thousand.

Text_en: Well, it ate it.
Text_ortho: Toh e con chop am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Well, he ate it.

Text_en: The one that eventually died, she gave me four eggs.
Text_ortho: Di one kuma wey she con die, she do four egg for me.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The one kuma, she died, she made four eggs for me.

Text_en: Then I added the eggs to that one.
Text_ortho: I con join di egg wit dat one.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I joined the egg with that one.

Text_en: Well.
Text_ortho: Toh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright.

Text_en: If they want to hatch the eggs, they will sit on the eggs for around thirty five days.
Text_ortho: If de wan born di egg, dem go do like thirty five days on top di egg.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If they want to give birth to the egg, they are to leave the egg for about thirty five days.

Text_en: Well.
Text_ortho: Toh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright.

Text_en: Now, they are done brooding.
Text_ortho: Now kukuma de don do.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The kukuma they have done.

Text_en: This one here, she hatched her eggs.
Text_ortho: Dis one ma, she born.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This one, she gave birth to a child.

Text_en: She hatched ten of her eggs.
Text_ortho: She born ten.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: She had ten children.

Text_en: Well, I don't have money, so I s-... sold them for five hundred naira each.
Text_ortho: Toh I no get money, I con s-... sell dem five, five hundred.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Well, I didn't have money, so I s-... sell them for five hundred.

Text_en: I sold nine.
Text_ortho: I sell nine.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm selling nine.

Text_en: Well.
Text_ortho: Toh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright.

Text_en: Eventually now, yesterday, I came back in the night and I saw this one.
Text_ortho: Now kuma yesterday, I come back in di night, I see dis one.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now, yesterday, I came back in the middle of the night and I found this one.

Text_en: They have moved... given me chicks.
Text_ortho: Dem con move, born for me.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then they moved and gave birth to me.

Text_en: So I caged them up and I went out to buy them food.
Text_ortho: Naim I pack dem go buy food for dem.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then I went and got them food for them.

Text_en: Then I fed them.
Text_ortho: Con put am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then he added it.

Text_en: Uh... the food uh... this is the food.
Text_ortho: Ehn di food ehn, na di food be dis.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehn, the food uh... is this food.

Text_en: The food.
Text_ortho: Di abinci.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The abin.

Text_en: Food, right?
Text_ortho: Food ba?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Food, right?

Text_en: Right!
Text_ortho: Yauwa!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Yauwa!

Text_en: That's the food.
Text_ortho: Na di food be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That's the food.

Text_en: Now, by the time I got back, I had just two hundred [naira] with me.
Text_ortho: Now kuma di time wey I come back, na two hundred dey my hand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And when I came back, two hundred naira was in my hand.

Text_en: I went for one hundred naira's worth.
Text_ortho: I go buy hundred naira own.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'll buy my own worth a hundred naira.

Text_en: I gave the, the big one, I served it to them.
Text_ortho: I give di, di big one put am for dem.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I gave the... the big one to them.

Text_en: And then, I went out to buy a Fitila lantern.
Text_ortho: Now kuma, I go buy fitila, lantern.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now, Uma, I'll buy a clothe, a light.

Text_en: And I put it there.
Text_ortho: Come put am for dere.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You are to put it down there.

Text_en: <hau> Shi, ke nan <hau>.
Text_ortho: Shi ke nan.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Shi ke nan.

Text_en: Eh.
Text_ortho: Eh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Eh.

Text_en: They eat rice, Indomie, like rice pudding, yams, bread.
Text_ortho: Dem dey eat rice, indomie, like tuwo, yam, bread.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They eat rice and indomie, like tuwo, yam, bread.

Text_en: Now, if I get... if I buy two... three fifty naira's worth of loaves of bread, they'll eat it.
Text_ortho: Now, if I get, if I buy bread two, three fifty ma, de go chop am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now, if I have... if I buy two or three fifty pounds of bread, they will eat it.

Text_en: Quickly, now, now, now.
Text_ortho: Just now, now, now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Just now, now, now.

Text_en: That's if it's in the daytime.
Text_ortho: If na day be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If it's a day.

Text_en: Right now, I have bread, which I have come to give, give them.
Text_ortho: Now ma, I get bread wey I con give, give dem.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now, myself, I have some bread to give them.

Text_en: Or should I take the bread, right.
Text_ortho: Or mey I carry di bread ma.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Or let me take the bread.

Text_en: Should I bring it, so you see it, well.
Text_ortho: Mey I bring am, mey you see toh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Let me bring it... let you see.

Text_en: They are over there, living off me.
Text_ortho: De dey dere dey chop money like.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They were there, eating money like that.

Text_en: If I have money, they will eat meals worth five hundred, courtesy of me.
Text_ortho: If I get money, de go chop like five hundred for my hand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If I have money, they will eat about five hundred pounds in my hand.

Text_en: No problem.
Text_ortho: No wahala.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: No problem at all.

Text_en: If sometimes I don't have money, they will... they will be calm.
Text_ortho: If kuma, if I no get money, dem ma, de go cool down.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If kuma... if I don't have money, they will come down.

Text_en: Well, did you see?
Text_ortho: Toh you see?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright, you see?

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Yes.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Yes.

Text_en: They're a kind of security.
Text_ortho: Dem be security.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They are security.

Text_en: Now, if you come in... if you come in the house, it will be making sounds like kwulukwulukwuluu.
Text_ortho: Now if you enter, if you enter di house, e go dey do kwulukwulukwuluu.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now if you go in... if you go into the house, it will be doing kwukwuuuu.

Text_en: Kwulukwulukwuluu.
Text_ortho: Kwulukwulukwuluu.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Kwulukwuluu.

Text_en: Kwulukwulukwuluu.
Text_ortho: Kwulukwulukwuluu.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Kwulukwuluu.

Text_en: Why won't I report it?
Text_ortho: Kwulukwulu.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Kwulukwulu.

Text_en: Well, did you see?
Text_ortho: Toh you see?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright, you see?

Text_en: Now if I...
Text_ortho: Now if I...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now if I...

Text_en: Even if I am not around, if you come in, it will be doing this.
Text_ortho: Even dai if I no dey, if you enter, e go dey do dis.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Even if I don't... if you go in, he will do these things.

Text_en: Even the people outside, they will come in.
Text_ortho: Even dai people dey outside, de go con enter.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Even the people outside, they will come in.

Text_en: Look, what is wrong with the, th-... this thing?
Text_ortho: Look, wetin dey worry di d-... dis ting?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Look, what's bothering the d-... this thing?

Text_en: Correct!
Text_ortho: Yauwa!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Yauwa!

Text_en: Did you see?
Text_ortho: You see?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You see?

Text_en: If they see a snake, they will kill it.
Text_ortho: If dem see snake, de go kill am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They will kill him if they see a snake.

Text_en: If they see a snake, they will kill it.
Text_ortho: If dem see snake, de will kill am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They will kill him if they see a snake.

Text_en: Even though rats, they come out, they will go after it, and kill it.
Text_ortho: Even dough rat, if e comot, de go follow am, kill am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Even the rath, if he comes out, will go after him and put him to death.

Text_en: Now if they are sleeping, look at the place where they kill it, that veranda.
Text_ortho: Now if dem dey sleep, see di place wey dem dey kill am dat baranda place.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now if they are sleeping, see the place where they have put him to death in that baranda.

Text_en: Correct!
Text_ortho: Yauwa.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Yauwa.

Text_en: Rain does not bother them at all.
Text_ortho: Rain no dey do dem anyting.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They don’t have anything to drink.

Text_en: As long as this thing on their heads has been finished, the rain doesn't disturb them in any way.
Text_ortho: If de don finish dis ting wey dey deir head, rain no dey do dem anyting.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If they finish this thing on their heads, they don’t get rain on them.

Text_en: Now myself, I don't have a cage at the moment.
Text_ortho: Now me, I no get cage now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now myself, I don't have a cage.

Text_en: It's outside they sleep.
Text_ortho: Na for outside dem dey sleep.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They are sleeping outside.

Text_en: Now this one, it's inside the room I will keep it.
Text_ortho: Na dis one, na for inside room I go con keep am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This one, it's in the inner room where I will keep it.

Text_en: Correct!
Text_ortho: Yauwa!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Yauwa!

Text_en: <hau> Ah gaskiya dai! <hau>
Text_ortho: Ah gaskiya dai!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ah, gaskiya dai!

Text_en: Ah, the meat is delicious!
Text_ortho: Ah di meat sweet o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ah, the meat is tasty!

Text_en: Honestly, the meat is delicious.
Text_ortho: Gaskiya di meat sweet.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Gachiah the meat was sweet.

Text_en: Now you see this one, if I want to sell it, I'll get around seven thousand, or eigth thousand.
Text_ortho: Now you see dis one, if I want go sell am now, I go get like seven thousand, or eight thousand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Now you see this one, if I want to sell it now, I will get somewhere between seven thousand or eight thousand.

Text_en: If it's during the Christmas season, well, I can get around ten thousand.
Text_ortho: If na Christmas time, toh I go fit get like ten thousand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If it's Christmas time, well, I can get a price of ten thousand.

Text_en: But uh... the female... it won't be more than four thousand... three thousand five hundred.
Text_ortho: But eh di woman, e no go pass four thousand, three five.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But uh... the woman... it's not over four thousand three five.

Text_en: Well, but it's the male...
Text_ortho: Toh but na di man...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Well, but it's the man...

Text_en: The male is very big.
Text_ortho: Di man too big now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The man is too big now.

Text_en: Correct, they don't like the female.
Text_ortho: Yauwa de no like di woman.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The woman was disgusting to Yuwa.

Text_en: They like the male very much.
Text_ortho: Dem like di man well.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They liked the man.

Text_en: If they want to eat over there, the, the male has so much meat.
Text_ortho: If de want chop over dere, di, di man get meat sosei.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If they want to eat there, the, the man has a meat sample.

Text_en: This one, no meat.
Text_ortho: Dis one, no meat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This one, no meat.

Text_en: Now, I have six.
Text_ortho: Now na six I get.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I have six.

Text_en: Six uh... with that one.
Text_ortho: Six eh with dat one.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Six uh... with that one.

Text_en: The dog has eaten one.
Text_ortho: Dog don chop one now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Dogs have eaten one.

Text_en: The dog has eaten one.
Text_ortho: Dog don chop one.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The dog had taken one.

Text_en: Why won't I report it?
Text_ortho: Why I no go go tell?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Why won't I go to say?

Text_en: I won't tell them so they might pay me.
Text_ortho: I no go tell dem mey dem pay me.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I won't ask them to pay me.

Text_en: I just forgot about it.
Text_ortho: I just forget am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I just forgot about it.

Text_en: Okay, my name is Bassey.
Text_ortho: Okay my name na Bassey.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Okay, my name is Bassey.

Text_en: People call me Skata.
Text_ortho: People call me Skata.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was called Skata.

Text_en: Um... I like to drink uh... beer, but not all beers.
Text_ortho: Em I like to drink ehn beer, but not all beer.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Em, I like to drink uh... beer, but not all beer.

Text_en: I like to drink uh... Stout, but today, I just decided to drink uh... Gulder.
Text_ortho: I like to drink ehn Stout, but today I just decide to drink ehn Gulder.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I like to drink uh... Stout, but today I decided to drink uh... Gulder.

Text_en: We have uh... Stout, we have Gulder, we have uh... Origin, we have uh... Star, we have uh... different brands of beer.
Text_ortho: We have ehn Stout, we have Gulder, we have ehn Origin, we have ehn Star, we have ehn different type of beer.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We have uh... Stout, we have Gulder, we have uh... Origin, we have uh... Star, we have uh... different types of beer.

Text_en: But I like drinking Stout because...
Text_ortho: But why I like to drink Stout is dat...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But why I like to drink Stout...

Text_en: The, the reason I like drinking Stout is because Stout doesn't...
Text_ortho: Di, di reason why I dey like to drink Stout is because Stout no dey...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The... the reason why I like to drink Stout is because the Stout doesn't...

Text_en: When you drink Stout, you don't need to go piss, piss all the time.
Text_ortho: When you drink Stout, you no go dey go piss, piss all di time.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: When you drink Stout, you won't go out, you won't go out all the time.

Text_en: Because... and it will also keep your belly full.
Text_ortho: Because, and e will hold your stommy also.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because, and it will hold your tommy too.

Text_en: If you want to go a long way, you don't need to go to the bathroom every now and then.
Text_ortho: If you wan go long distance, you no go dey go toilet every now and den.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If you want to go long, you won't be going to the toilet every time.

Text_en: Stout will keep your belly nice and full.
Text_ortho: Dat Stout go hold your bele well, well.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Stout will hold your bele very well.

Text_en: That's why I like Stout.
Text_ortho: Dat is di reason why I like Stout.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I love Stout.

Text_en: But uh... many people prefer the other brands as well.
Text_ortho: But ehn many people like oda branches also.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But uh... many people also love other branches.

Text_en: And I like to come to this uh... place because their drinks are not expensive.
Text_ortho: And I like to come to dis ehn place because deir drink no dey cost.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And I like to come to this uh... place, because their drink is not expensive.

Text_en: You will go to some places and they will tell you the Stout is four fifty a bottle... five hundred.
Text_ortho: E get some places wey you go, di Stout, de go tell you four fifty for one bottle, five hundred.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: There are some places you will go to the Stout... they will tell you four fifty five hundred naira in one bottle.

Text_en: But in this place, you can buy it for three thou-... three hundred and fifty naira here, and drink.
Text_ortho: But dis place, you can buy three thou-... three hundred and fifty naira here, and drink.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But this place, you can buy this three t-... three hundred and fifty naira here and take drinks.

Text_en: And beer also, though it's good, it's not very good for young people... for children.
Text_ortho: And beer also, though it is good but e no dey good too much for young people, for children.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And beer too, though it's good, it's not too good for young people, for children.

Text_en: Someone who has... who is not uh... eighteen years or older yet is not supposed to be drinking beer.
Text_ortho: Person wey don, wey no dey reach ehn eighteen years above, e no suppose dey drink beer.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The person who has... who is not up to uh... eighteen years old, he's not supposed to drink beer.

Text_en: Because if they start drinking beer, it will affect them negatively.
Text_ortho: Because, if dem start to drink beer, e no go do well for dem.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because, if they start drinking alcohol, it won't be good for them.

Text_en: They won't behave well at home.
Text_ortho: De no go dey behave well in di house.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They will not behave well in the house.

Text_en: Even in school, they won't concentrate.
Text_ortho: Even for deir school, dem no go concentrate.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For their school, they won't concentrate.

Text_en: So it's good for someone to be over eighteen before they can start drinking uh... beer.
Text_ortho: So is good for someone to grow above di age of eighteen before e can start to dey take ehn beer.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So it's good for someone to get past eighteen before he can start drinking uh... beer.

Text_en: But beer is very good because it will help you.
Text_ortho: But beer is very good because e would help you.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But beer is very good because it will help you.

Text_en: It will make you know... I mean feel bold.
Text_ortho: E would make you know, I mean feel bold.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He would make you know... I mean, be bold.

Text_en: It will make you feel bold at all times.
Text_ortho: E go make you to dey feel bold at all time.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He will make you strong at all times.

Text_en: Apart from that, I also come in here to eat, most of the times because here, their food is good.
Text_ortho: Apart from dat, I come here also most of di time to chop because deir food here is good also.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And apart from that, I came here most of the time to eat, because their food here is good.

Text_en: It's uh... hygenic.
Text_ortho: Is ehn hygienic.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Is uh... hygienic.

Text_en: It's clean.
Text_ortho: Is clean.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It's clean.

Text_en: They prepare it... they cook it the way everybody likes it.
Text_ortho: De prepare it, de cook it di way wey everybody like it.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They cook it... cook it the way everybody like it.

Text_en: They are from Calabar.
Text_ortho: De are Calabar people.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They are the people of Calabar.

Text_en: As we all know, Calabar people are the ones who know the most about how to cook.
Text_ortho: As we know, Calabar people na dem dey sabi cook food pass.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We know that the Calabarites are the best cookers of food.

Text_en: So I always come here to eat with them.
Text_ortho: So I always come here to chop with dem.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So I always came to take food with them.

Text_en: They have... they've got edikaikon here, they have epankwokwo, the have garri (eba), and soup; they have uh...
Text_ortho: De have, de get edikaikon here, de get epankwokwo, de get garri, and soup, de get eh...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They have edikaikon here, they have epankwo, they have garri, and soup, they have uh...

Text_en: About the soup, they have uh... afiaifere, ebot; they have uh... otong, they have uh... ogkuoafan, they have uh...
Text_ortho: For di soup, de get ehn afiaifere, ebot, de get ehn otong, de get eh ogkuoafan, de, de get eh...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For the dish, they have uh... afiaifere, ebot, they have uh... uh... uh... ogkuoafan, they, they have uh...

Text_en: At times, they also have diedesi here, they have iwuhabia, they have ozobuko.
Text_ortho: At time, de get diedesi sef here also, de get iwuhabia, de get ozobuko.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: At that time, they also got deaddesi... here also, they have iwuhabia, they have ozobuko.

Text_en: In fact, they have all kinds of food here.
Text_ortho: In fact de get all type of food here.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: In fact, there's plenty of food here.

Text_en: They also have pepper soup.
Text_ortho: De get pepper soup also.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They also have pepper sauce.

Text_en: They have uh... cowtail pepper soup, they have fish pepper soup too.
Text_ortho: De get ehn cowtail peppersoup, de get fish pepper soup also.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They have uh... cowsop, and fishes also.

Text_en: So everything is here.
Text_ortho: So everything is here.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So everything is here.

Text_en: They have everything someone can eat and enjoy here.
Text_ortho: De get everything here dat someone can eat and enjoy.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Everything here is for someone to eat and enjoy.

Text_en: Uh... myself, most of the times... a lot of the time when I come here, I, I like to eat afiafherebo, yeah, and auzomahbiah.
Text_ortho: Ehn mysef, most of di time, many time, when I come here, I, I like to chop afiafherebo, yeah and auzomahbiah.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehn, my own, most of the time, when I come here, I, I like to eat afiafherebo, yeah, and Auzomahbiah.

Text_en: For auzomahbiah, they prepare it with uh... yam.
Text_ortho: For dat auzomahbiah, dey use eh yam to make it.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That Auzomahbiah uses uh... yam to make it.

Text_en: They pound the yam.
Text_ortho: De pound di yam.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They pound the yam.

Text_en: The whites call it pounded yam.
Text_ortho: Oyinbo people call it pounded yam.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Oyinbo people call it pounded yam.

Text_en: But with afihafereboh, they add uh... goat meat in it, and they prepare it in such a way that they don't put any...
Text_ortho: But dat afihafereboh, de put eh goat meat dere, and de prepare it in di way dat de don't put any...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But that afihafereboh, they put uh... goat meat there, and they prepare it in a way they don't put any...

Text_en: They cook it in the... in the way where they don't add vegetable leaves to it.
Text_ortho: De cook it in di, in di way de don't put leaf dere.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They cook it in the... in a way they don't put leaf there.

Text_en: The soup is peer... pure white.
Text_ortho: Di soup na peer, pure white.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And the dish was white.

Text_en: Just white like that.
Text_ortho: Just white like dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Just white like that.

Text_en: I have finished now.
Text_ortho: I don finish now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I've finished finishing.

Text_en: This is a very short story that's coming your way on ninety five point one, Wazobia FM on this fifth day in June twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: Dis one na short, short tori wey dey waka come your domot on top ninety five point one, Wazobia FM for dis number five day for inside dis June twenty seventeen.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This is a short, short story coming to you on ninety five point one, Wazobia FM, on this number five days in this June twenty seventeen.

Text_en: Alright, listen carefully so you can hear the big news.
Text_ortho: Oya plaster your ear for your radio make you hear di matter as e dey hot.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You should plaster your ear on your radio to hear the matter as it gets heated up.

Text_en: Yesterday, the Federal Government said they will not hesitate to expose people whose work is... whose work is to spread fake news all over the country.
Text_ortho: Federal Government, for yesterday, don yarn sey e no go drag leg until im expose dose people wey deir work dey, wey deir work na to dey carry fake news up, and down for di country.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Federal Government, yesterday, has said that he will not drag a leg until he exposes those working in the country, who their work is to bring out fake news in the country.

Text_en: And they will bring them to justice.
Text_ortho: And dem go carry justice hang for deir neck.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And they are to have the rod of righteousness fixed by a cord on their necks.

Text_en: The Senate president, Doctor Bukola Saraki, announced to the house that it will not be appropriate for the politicians who are currently in office to abandon their offices and duties in pursuit of victory in the upcoming twenty nineteen elections.
Text_ortho: Presido for Senate, Doctor Bukola Saraki e don yarn in di whole house sey e no go make brain for politicians wey dey office now to leave deir office and deir duty to dey busy dey think of twenty nineteen election matter.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The President of the Senate Senate, Doctor Bukola Saraki, said in all the house that he will not engage in political parties who are in office to leave their offices and focus on the twenty nineteen election issue.

Text_en: The Senator representing Ogun East, Buruji Kashamu, said he's not happy at all that Ekiti State Governor, Ayodele Fayose, is saying that President Mohammadu Buhari should drop his letter of resignation.
Text_ortho: Senator wey dey representate Ogun East, Buruji Kashamu don yarn sey bele no sweet am at all as Ekiti State Governor, Ayodele Fayose, as im dey yarn sey make Presido Mohammadu Buhari drop letter of resign.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Senator representing Ogun East, Buruji Kashamu has said that it's not good at all as Ekiti State Governor, Ayodele Fayose, as he was saying that President Mohammadu Buhari should drop a letter of resign.

Text_en: The National Assembly has declared that it's not possible... that the Senate has nothing to do with the story circulating around that the pump price of petrol will increse in... by five naira, saying they did not even discuss anything like that.
Text_ortho: National Assemble don yarn sey mbanu nu, sey senate hand no dey inside di tori wey dey fly sey de wan increase fuel price for, by five naira, sey de never even discuss anything like dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The National Assemble has said that mbanu, that mstchew, there's nothing in the news that they want to raise the price of fuel in... by five naira, they have not even mentioned anything like that.

Text_en: The Kogi State Governor, Yahaya Bello's name has, like magic, disappeared from the voters register after he was accused of registering twice.
Text_ortho: Kogi State Governor, Yahaya Bello name don do willy, willy disappear comot for voter's register after dem point am finger of accuse sey im register two times.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Kogi State Governor, Yahaya Bello's name, has done willi, willi, will disappear on the ballot after they tipped him with a finger of accusation that he registered two times.

Text_en: The House of Representatives has given the Controller General of Nigeria Immigration Service, also known as NIS, Muhamed Babandele, uh... till Wednesday to appear in the... before them or they will employ force again him.
Text_ortho: House of Representate don sama di Controller General of Nigeria Immigration Service alias NIS, Muhamed Babandele eh till on Wednesday to show for di, before dem or de go use by force take follow am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The House of Representate has released the controller General General of Nigeria International Service alias NIS, Muhamed Babandele uh... on Wednesday to show the... before they will use force to follow him.

Text_en: The Federal Inland Revenue Service, also known as FR-... FRIS, has released what they call the six key electronic solution, also known as e-services, so as to make it easy for people to pay their taxes.
Text_ortho: Federal Inland Revenue Service alias FR, FIRS don sama wetin dem dey call six key electronic solution alias e-services so dat e go make things easy for people to pay tax.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Federal Inland Revenue Service alias FR... FIRS has released six key electronic solutions for e-... service to make tax payments easier.

Text_en: The Chief Justice of Nigeria... of Nigerian, also known as NJC, Justice Walter Onnoghen, has announced the appointment of Mrs Had-... Hadizatu Uwani Mustapha as the Chief Registrar of the Supreme Court.
Text_ortho: Di chief jojo of Nigeria, of Nigerian, alias NJC, Justice Walter Onnoghen don announcement di appoint of Mrs Had-... Hadizatu Uwani Mustapha as di Chief Registrar for Supreme Court.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Chief Jojo of Nigeria, of Nigerian, of Nigerian, alias JJC, Justice Walter Onnoghen, announced the appointment of Mrs Had-... Hadizatu Uwani Mustapha as the Chief Registrar of the Supreme Court.

Text_en: The Lagos State Independent Electoral Commission, also known as LASIEC, has received the list of candidates for the All Progressive Congress, APC, to run for the seats of the Chairman and councillors in next month's Local Government election.
Text_ortho: Lagos State Independent Electoral Commission alias LASIEC don receive di list of candidate for All Progressive Congress, APC to contest for chairmo and councillor seat for next month local government election.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Lagos State Independent Electoral Commission alias LASIEC has received the list of candidates for All Progressive Congress, APC, to run for Chairmo and Councillor seats in the next month Local Government election.

Text_en: Bad guys, robbers, have gone to the great beyond.
Text_ortho: Bad guys robbers don kpai go yonder.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Bad guys robbers have made a profit out of you.

Text_en: A bank agent withdrew two million naira from his account for the four Local Government areas in Ogun State.
Text_ortho: One bank agent con withdrawal two million naira from im account for di four local government area inside Ogun State.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: A bank official withdraws two million naira from his account on the four local government area of Ogun State.

Text_en: In the white man's country.
Text_ortho: For obodo Oyibo.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For the people of Andibo.

Text_en: Twelve people have been arrested by the Police for their involvement in the terror attack that occurred in London.
Text_ortho: Na twelve people na im ekelebe don gbab sake of deir hand dirty on top di kabun badness of terror attack wey happen for London.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The ekelebe has ruined her hands in London over the terror attack on London.

Text_en: For buying and selling.
Text_ortho: For buying, and selling.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For buying and selling.

Text_en: The way the Nigerian nai-... naira is appreciating these days will ensure that the Central Bank of Nigeria, also known as CBN, continues to monitor the financial market, which will encourage better results.
Text_ortho: Di way wey Naija, nai, naira dey get muscle dis days, e no go stop Central Bank of Nigeria alias CBN to dey shook eyes on top different bank market matter wey go carry dem go ahead, ahead.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The way Nigerians use Nigeria, naira, these days, it will not stop the Central Bank of Nigeria alias CBN to focus on different bank products that will move forward.

Text_en: In entertainment news, our Nigerian rapper, Eva Alordiah...
Text_ortho: For jolijoli, we Naija rapper, Eva Allordiah.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: In jolijoli, we Nigerian rapper, Eva Allordiah.

Text_en: My name is Edewoh.
Text_ortho: My name na Edewoh.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: My name is Edewoh.

Text_en: Or the way it's called in my... in my area is Edewo.
Text_ortho: Or di way de dey call am for my, for my area na Edewo.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Or the way they call it in my... in my area is Edewo.

Text_en: Because uh... I'm a Delta boy; I'm Urhobo.
Text_ortho: Because eh I be Delta boy, I be Urhobo.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because uh... I'm a Delta boy, I'm Urhobo.

Text_en: And uh... I come from a family of six, and I'm the fourth born, actually
Text_ortho: And eh I come from family of six, and I be fourth born actually.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And uh... I'm from a family of six, and I'm the fourth.

Text_en: But initally uh... while growing up, because it's... it's... it's... I was born in Lagos, you know, my mom and dad... we speak English there, mostly, because they wan-...
Text_ortho: But initially eh, growing up, because sey na, na, na, na Lagos de born me you know, my papa and, mama, we dey speak English dere mostly because de wan...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But at first uh... growing up because it's... it's... it's... it's Lagos that gave birth to me, you know, my father and mother, we speak English mostly because we want...

Text_en: The whole idea of...
Text_ortho: Di whole ehn idea of sey ehn...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The whole uh... idea of uh...

Text_en: To know a kid who, who's educated, they're supposed to speak English really well.
Text_ortho: To know pikin wey, wey don go school, e suppose dey speak English very well.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: To know a kid who... who has gone to school, he should speak English very well.

Text_en: So they started from when they were little.
Text_ortho: So de start from small.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So, that's how they started from childhood.

Text_en: English was the language they used... they, they... that they spoke to us in.
Text_ortho: Na English de dey use us, dey use, dey, dey, dey follow us talk.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They use us, they use us, they are, they are, they are talking to us.

Text_en: So, it also has its down sides because here as we speak, I can't speak my language.
Text_ortho: So dat one self con get im own bad side because, as I dey like dis, I no sabi speak my language.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So, that one of us came into his own bad situation because, as I like this, I don't know my language.

Text_en: Haha, something like that.
Text_ortho: Haha dat kind thing so.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Haha, that kind of thing.

Text_en: It's more like that.
Text_ortho: Na more like dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It's even more.

Text_en: And I... (you know then), I associated with people as I grew up, and I realized that people speak different languages.
Text_ortho: And I con (you know den) association with people as I dey grow, I con dey see sey ah people don con dey speak different.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And I got into (you know) association with people as I was growing up, I realized that uh... people were speaking different things.

Text_en: It... it's like I'm an outcast in Lagos, where I stay.
Text_ortho: E, e con be like sey I be outcast for inside Lagos wey I dey.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It... it was as if I was outcast in Lagos, where I was.

Text_en: You know, people speak different languages.
Text_ortho: You know people dey speak different things.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know people speak different things.

Text_en: I figured, "ah, everyone's supposed to be speaking English."
Text_ortho: I con dey ah but na English everybody suppose dey speak.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was uh... but everybody should speak English.

Text_en: "What language is this Pidgin that people are speaking?"
Text_ortho: Which one be dis Pidgin wey people dey speak?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Whose is this Pidgin that people speak?

Text_en: You know, so I started picking it up little by little, I started to learn to speak it little by little, but uh... you know that every time you go back to the house, you'll be expected to speak English.
Text_ortho: You know so I con dey pick am up small, small, I con dey learn am small, small, but eh you know sey everytime wey you go back house, na still English you go speak.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, so I was picking it up gradually, I was learning it gradually, but uh... you know that every time you go back to your house, you will speak English.

Text_en: So I couldn’t master the language.
Text_ortho: So di thing still no dey sink.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So the thing still doesn't sink.

Text_en: You know, so, I started...
Text_ortho: You know so, I con...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, I came...

Text_en: You know be-... um... because I used to act, I used to work at another radio station before, before I came to... before I came to Wazobia, so since I resumed in Wazobia, it's more like...
Text_ortho: You know be-... ehn because I bin dey act, I bin dey work for one oda radio station before, before I start to, before I come ehn Wazobia, so as I come Wazobia now, na more like sey...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know be-... uh... because I've been acting... I've been working for one other radio station, before I started to... before I came uh... Wazobia, so as I came to Wazobia now, it's more like...

Text_en: Okay then, since they, they employed me to speak English on Cool TV, because at that time... we had Cool TV at that time, so was I hired to speak English.
Text_ortho: Okay den, as de, de employ me for English for Cool TV (because dat, dat time, Cool TV dey), so de employ me for English.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Alright then, as they... they employed me in English on Cool TV (because that, that time, Cool TV was there), so they employed me in English.

Text_en: As d-... I... as I...
Text_ortho: As d-... I, as I...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: As d-... I, as I...

Text_en: I still remember the way I perfomed in the audition, where, where my MD said, "now, speak Pidgin so we can hear how it'll sound."
Text_ortho: I still remember di day wey I do di audition, wey, wey my MD talk sey oya, speak for Pidgin mey we hear as thing take be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I still remember the day I auditioned, which... which my Mstchew... said that uh... speak Pidgin English, so we should hear what's happening.

Text_en: That’s how I started.
Text_ortho: Na so I start.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was how I started.

Text_en: He said no, no, no, no, no, no.
Text_ortho: E say no, no, no, no, no, no.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said no, no, no, no, no.

Text_en: I should speak English because it's like my spoken English is better.
Text_ortho: Make I speak English o because e be like sey na di English na im make sense pass for me.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Let me speak English because it's like the English makes sense to me.

Text_en: I said, "ah, there's a problem."
Text_ortho: I say ah wahala dey?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said, "ah, there's a problem?"

Text_en: He said, "no, don't worry, don't worry, don't worry!"
Text_ortho: E say no, no worry, no worry, no worry!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said no, don’t worry, don’t worry, don’t worry.

Text_en: He said that my spoken English was alright.
Text_ortho: E say di English dey alright.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said the English was alright.

Text_en: I should just stick to speaking English.
Text_ortho: Make I just dey for di English.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I should just be in English.

Text_en: You know but as time went on, they hired me here, you know.
Text_ortho: You know but as time con go on, de con employ me for here you know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, but as time goes on, they hired me here, you know.

Text_en: So I started working.
Text_ortho: I con start.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I started.

Text_en: We were broadcasting in English, we were... we were... we, we were broadcasting in Pidgin.
Text_ortho: We dey do English, we dey do, we dey do, we, we dey do Pidgin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We speak English, we do... we do... we, we do Pidgin English.

Text_en: Then, uh... there were some logistical issues, there were some technical issues.
Text_ortho: Den, ehn some kind ehn logistic issues con happen, technical issues con happen.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then, uh... some uh... logistic problems came up, technical problems came up.

Text_en: So we merged Cool TV into Wa-... Wazobia.
Text_ortho: We con merge ehn Cool TV into Wa-... Wazobia.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then we combined uh... Cool TV into Wa-... Wazobia.

Text_en: Then, everybody had to speak Pidgin.
Text_ortho: Nain everybody con start to gats dey speak di Pidgin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Everyone started speaking Pidgin English.

Text_en: Me, I started wondering, "ah, the Pidgin language I've been running away from has caught up to me right here!"
Text_ortho: Me, I con dey wonder sey ah dis Pidgin wey I don dey run from since don con meet me again for here!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Me, I was wondering that uh... this Pidgin I've been running from before, has found me again here!

Text_en: That’s how I started, and I'm still here, and I'm growing.
Text_ortho: Na so I start o, and I still dey be here, and I con dey grow.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That's how I started, and I'm still here, and I'm growing.

Text_en: Then I re-... uh... I realized that Pidgin is not a language that's meant for people who don't sa-... who aren't uh... intelligent.
Text_ortho: I con re-... eh realize sey di Pidgin no be ehn language for people wey no sa-... wey no ehn dey intelligent.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then I re-... uh... realized that the Pidgin is not uh... a language for people who don't uh... who don't uh... are intelligent.

Text_en: It's for Nigerians who wanna communicate, who wanna reach as many people as possible.
Text_ortho: Na for people wey be Nigerian, wey wan communicate, wey wan cut across.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For people who are Nigerians, who want to communicate... who want to cut across.

Text_en: Because since I don't speak my language now, I'm sure that if I go to Sapele, or Delta and I speak Pidgin, I'll be able to communicate with the people over there; but if I speak English, they'll be looking at me like, "ah, buddy, you should know that we don't speak that language here."
Text_ortho: Because as I no sabi speak my language so, I know sey if I still enter ehm ehm di Sapele, or enter di Delta speak Pidgin, I go fit relate to people for dere, but if I speak English, de go dey look me like sey ah bros we no dey speak dis language for here now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because I don’t know my language, I know that if I still enter uh... uh... the Sapele, or if I go to the Delta, I will be able to relate to people there, but if I speak English, they will look at me as a uh... brother, we don’t speak this language here.

Text_en: "We speak Uhrobo."
Text_ortho: Na Uhrobo we dey speak now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We speak Uhroboam now.

Text_en: "Why don't you speak the language we understand?"
Text_ortho: Why you no speak di one wey we know?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Why do you not speak up about what we know?

Text_en: You know.
Text_ortho: You know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know.

Text_en: So... but I realized that Pidgin... anywhere I go... (because I can say that I've been to as many as eighteen States in this country), and everywhere I go, Pidgin paves the way for me.
Text_ortho: So, but I con realize sey di Pidgin, anywhere wey I go (because I fit talk say I don travel go like eighteen states for dis, for dis country), and everywhere I go, Pidgin dey always dey represent.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So, but I realized that the Pidgin... anywhere I went... (because I could say I have travelled to eighteen states in this, in this country), and wherever I went, the Pidgin would always represent me.

Text_en: Even if it's not the same type of Pidgin they speak in Warri, but it's the one of I-... I-... Ibadan or it's the one of Abuja, you will realise that if you speak any kind of Pidgin, it works.
Text_ortho: Even if sey no be di same kind of Pidgin wey dey Warri, na im dey I-... I-... Ibadan, na im dey ehn Abuja, you go realise sey if you speak any kind Pidgin, e dey connect.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Even if it's not the same kind of Pidgin which is in Warri, it's in I-... I-... Ibadan that's in Abuja, you will realize that if you speak any kind of Pidgin English, it'll connect.

Text_en: People will still understand you, um... uh... what you're saying.
Text_ortho: People go still understand you, ehm ehw wetin you dey talk.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: People will still understand you uh... uh... what you're saying.

Text_en: So that's why I appreciate this platform because since I've been here, I haven't been lost.
Text_ortho: So na why I con even thank di platform say as I don dey here so, I no still lost.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So that's why I even thanked the platform saying that as I've been here, I still haven't lost.

Text_en: Because if I s-... if I get to a place where I'm expected to just speak English... I'm expected to be speaking... I'll be able to speak it and get along.
Text_ortho: Because if I s-... if I reach where na only English de want make I dey speak, I go dey speak am, we go dey flow.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because if I s-... if I get to a place where English is the only language they want me to speak, I will speak it and we will start speaking it.

Text_en: If I get to where I need to communicate with people (you know), where I have never been to before... if I want to go to a new place, I'll just be speaking Pidgin.
Text_ortho: If I reach where I need to communicate with people for (you know) where I no know before, if I wan go new area, na Pidgin I go dey speak.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: When I get to where I need to communicate with people in (you know) where I don't know, if I want to move to a new area, I will speak Pidgin English.

Text_en: So I started building up my vocabulary... I started building it up.
Text_ortho: So di thing con dey build up, e con dey build up.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So the thing started building up... it started building up.

Text_en: Yes, I realized that even right here, we were... we, we, we treated Pidgin like an, an international language.
Text_ortho: Aha I con realise sey for here too, we con dey, we, we, we con package Pidgin like sey na, na one, na international hehe language.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Aha, I realized that we were also here, we, we, we, we packed Pidgin like it's... it's an international uh... language.

Text_en: People will be...
Text_ortho: People go dey...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: People will be...

Text_en: Because myself, I, I organize shows where I... I... I... I go on the Red Carpet; I interview people.
Text_ortho: Because me, I dey, I dey do shows wey I dey, I, I dey, I dey, I dey go red carpets, I dey interview people.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because myself, I'm, I'm doing shows I'm, I, I'm, I'm, I'm going to red carpets, I'm interviewing people.

Text_en: So I'll dress really well, dress co-... in a fashionable way; in an official way; put on suits, everything.
Text_ortho: So I go cack well, dress co-... confirm o, cack well, wear suit, everything.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So I will dress well, dress co-... confirm well, dress well, wear suit, everything.

Text_en: And people will recognize my presence, saying "okay, he's from Wazobia, okay".
Text_ortho: And people go con stand okay yes na Wazobia okay.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And people will stand up, yes, it's Wazobia, okay.

Text_en: I want to tell the person, "we speak Pidgin, hope you don't mind."
Text_ortho: I want tell di person sey hope sey you no mind, na Pidgin we dey speak o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I want to tell the person that you don't mind... we speak Pidgin English.

Text_en: They'll say, "oh, we'll be speaking Pidgin?"
Text_ortho: Di man go say aha na Pidgin?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The man will say, "aha, it's Pidgin?"

Text_en: I say yes.
Text_ortho: I say yes.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said yes.

Text_en: They'll say uh... uh... you know, "oh yeah? But you know I don’t speak Pidgin very well."
Text_ortho: Sey ehn ehn you know sey ehn I no too sabi.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Saying uh... uh... you know that uh... I don't know too much.

Text_en: I say, "Ma'am, you're a Nigerian, right?"
Text_ortho: I say Madam, na Nigerian you be abi?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said, "Ma'am, are you a Nigerian, right?"

Text_en: "You'll speak this language."
Text_ortho: You go speak dis thing.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You will speak this thing.

Text_en: They said, "alright, alright, alright, let's try it out, let's try it out."
Text_ortho: E say oya, oya, oya mey we try, mey we try.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said, "now, let's try, let's try."

Text_en: And (so far so good), it's like anytime people see me on the Red Carpet, they'll want me to interview them because they know that this guy will want to speak Pidgin, not in English which we'll be struggling to speak.
Text_ortho: And (so far so good), e con be like sey anytime wey people see me for red carpet, de go wan come make I interview dem because de know sey dis guy, na, na Pidgin e wan talk, no be di English wey we go dey struggle to speak.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And (so far as it's good), it's like anytime people see me on a red carpet, they will want to interview them because they know this guy is... it's Pidgin he wants to talk, it's not the English we will be struggling to speak.

Text_en: We'll just be free.
Text_ortho: We go just dey free.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We'll just be free.

Text_en: We'll relate so well, you know.
Text_ortho: We go dey relate you know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We will be telling you, you know.

Text_en: So from here, the thing started to build up.
Text_ortho: So from there, di thing con dey build up.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So from there, the thing started building up.

Text_en: There was awareness.
Text_ortho: Di awareness con dey.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The awareness was there.

Text_en: Everywhere we go, they say, "ah, it's wo-... Wazobia."
Text_ortho: Everywhere where we go, de say ah na wo-... Wazobia.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Everywhere we went, they said, "ah, it's wo-... Wazobia."

Text_en: You speak the best Pidgin.
Text_ortho: Na una dey speak Pidgin pass.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You are the sons of Pidgin.

Text_en: That’s your work.
Text_ortho: Na una work be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: This is your work.

Text_en: You know, so it started building up its own uh... level of acceptance, across... everywhere.
Text_ortho: You know so, di thing con dey build im own ehn level of acceptance, across, everywhere.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, the thing is building up his own uh... level of acceptance across across the world.

Text_en: There's no event we attend, even if the Pre-... President will be coming...
Text_ortho: No event wey we go even if sey na pre-... president dey come.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: There's no event we attended even if it's pre-... President.

Text_en: You know I... there was a day I... that I interviewed the Minister of Information.
Text_ortho: You know I, dere was one day wey I, wey I eh interview di Informations Minister.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know I... there was one day when I... when I uh... interviewed the Information Minister.

Text_en: That's uh... Lai Muhammed.
Text_ortho: Dat na ehn Lai Muhammed.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That's uh... Lai Muhammed.

Text_en: And he, he, he, he, he was asking me "how far now? So, how will it go?"
Text_ortho: And im, im, im, im, im dey follow me dey talk sey how far now, so how will it be?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And he, he, he, he, he's with me, asking me, "how far now, how will it be?"

Text_en: I, I said, "No Sir, we speak Pidgin here."
Text_ortho: I, I say no Sir, na Pidgin we dey speak for here.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I, I said no Sir, we are talking about Pidgin here.

Text_en: He said uh... "ah, alright, let's do it now, we are Nigerians, this is our language."
Text_ortho: E say eh ah oya make we do am now, na Nigerian we be, na our language.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said uh... ah, let's do it right now, since we're Nigerian, that's our language.

Text_en: So we started speaking.
Text_ortho: We con dey flow.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then we started going.

Text_en: So pi-... people who interviewed him before me saw us laughing, cracking jokes, laughing... ah.
Text_ortho: So pi-... people wey dey interview am before con see sey we dey laugh, we dey crack joke, we dey laugh ah.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So pi-... people who interviewed him before then saw that we were laughing, we were cracking jokes, we were laughing uh...

Text_en: So they were wondering what I was telling him that, that was making him laugh so much... that was making the old man laugh so much.
Text_ortho: De con dey wonder sey wetin I dey tell am wey, wey bros dey laugh like dis, wey papa dey laugh like dis?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They were wondering if what I was telling him was, that a brother is laughing like this, a father is laughing like this.

Text_en: What was I telling him?
Text_ortho: Wetin I dey tell am?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: What am I saying to him?

Text_en: I said "ah!"
Text_ortho: I say ah!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say, ah!

Text_en: Then I realized that, wow, this Pidgin brought us together.
Text_ortho: I con realise sey omo na dis Pidgin na im make us connect like dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I realized that omo, it's this Pidgin that made us connect like that.

Text_en: We finished the interview.
Text_ortho: We finish di interview finish.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We finished the interview.

Text_en: He shook my hand and he said, "well done, young man; this is good, this one is... this is Nigerian."
Text_ortho: E shake my hand, e say well done young man, correct, dis one wey, dis na Nigerian.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He shaken my hand, he said well done to a young man, right, this one, this is a Nigerian.

Text_en: I said, "yes sir, we’re doing our best, we’re doing our best."
Text_ortho: I say yes Sir, we dey try, we dey try.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said yes, Sir, we are doing our best.

Text_en: So that’s the platform that uh... Wazobia has created for us, which made us realize that Pidgin English isn't just the language of the uneducated.
Text_ortho: So na di platform wey ehn Wazobia con create for us be dat, wey con let us know sey dis Pidgin English no be language wey be for people wey no s-... wey no sabi.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So, it's the platform which uh... Wazobia created for us, which allows us know that this Pidgin English is not a language for people who don't s-... who don't know anything about it.

Text_en: It's not a language that, that people that are...
Text_ortho: No be for language wey, wey people wey be...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Not in a language which... which people are...

Text_en: Because they say it's for the people on the streets, it's for uh... the riffraff.
Text_ortho: Because de dey call am sey na for people wey dey street, na for ehn low life people.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because they call it for people who are on the street, it's for uh... low people.

Text_en: They're the ones who speak Pidgin.
Text_ortho: Na im dey speak di Pidgin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He's the one who speaks the Pidgin English.

Text_en: But then you realize that it’s the only language that cuts across Nigeria without any issues.
Text_ortho: But you now con realise sey na di only language wey cut across Nigeria without any stress.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But you now realize that it's the only language across across Nigeria without any stress.

Text_en: Yo can go anywhere now if you... if you note... if there...
Text_ortho: You fit go anywhere now if you, if you note, if dere...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You can go anywhere now if you... if you note... if there is...

Text_en: Some time... some time ago, when I... when I went to SA, I w-... I went to South Africa, and I was just... because it's... it's English, we believe everybody will understand.
Text_ortho: One, one time wey I, wey I go SA, I g-... I go South Africa, and I just dey because na, na English we believe sey everybody go dey understand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: One, when I... when I went to SA, I g-... I went to South Africa, and I was just there because we believe that everybody will understand English.

Text_en: But when I was there, I went into a mall and I saw a black guy.
Text_ortho: But as I con dey, I just enter one mall, naim I see one black man.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But as I was... I just went into a mall, I saw a black man.

Text_en: Me and the guy, we were just chatting in Pidgin because we want... we didn't want... we didn't, didn't want anybody else hear what we were saying.
Text_ortho: Me, and my guy, we just dey talk for Pidgin because we wan, we no wan no, make, make de hear wetin we talk.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Me, and my guy, we're just talking about Pidgin because we want... we don't want to... let them hear what we're saying.

Text_en: We were just talking in Pidgin, so the man asked me, "ah, man, how far? Are you a Nigerian?"
Text_ortho: We just dey talk for Pidgin, nain di man just tell me sey ah bros, how far, you be Nigerian?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We're just talking about Pidgin, the man just told me, "ah, brother, how far are you Nigerian?"

Text_en: I said, "oh, you understand, right?"
Text_ortho: I say oh you understand abi?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say, "oh, you understand, right?"

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Hehe.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Hehe.

Text_en: I said, "good, good, yeah, I'm Nigerian."
Text_ortho: I say correct, correct, yea I be Nigerian o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said, "right, right, I'm a Nigerian."

Text_en: He said he himself is Nigerian, but he's been here for almost twelve years.
Text_ortho: E say im sef na Nigerian o, but e don dey here for like twelve years.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said he's also a Nigerian, but he's been here for almost twelve years.

Text_en: I said, "aha, hope you are... will you be coming back to Nigeria?"
Text_ortho: I say aha hope sey you dey, you dey come back Naija?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say, "aha, hope you're... you're coming back from Nigeria?"

Text_en: So I said... he said he comes back every year, but he is w-... uh... working in South Africa.
Text_ortho: So I say, e say im dey come back every year sha, but im dey w-... ehn work for South Africa.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So I said... he said he's coming back every year, but he's w-... uh... working in South Africa.

Text_en: I said "ah, good, good!"
Text_ortho: I say ah correct, correct!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say, "ah, right, right!"

Text_en: So I realised that Pidgin, on its own, has gotten to a level where...
Text_ortho: So I now realise sey as e dey like dis, Pidgin on im own o, ah e don reach where...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So I realized that as it was like this, Pidgin on himself, ah, he had reached where...

Text_en: But I, I know that if, if, if given a little time now, it can get to the level where French uh... where English can be above it.
Text_ortho: I, I know sey dough, if, if, if na small time now, e go fit reach level wey French, ehn wey English fit con top am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I, I know that though, if, if, if, if it's a little time now, it will be able to get to French, uh... English.

Text_en: You know, it will create its own...
Text_ortho: You know, e go create im own...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know he will create his own...

Text_en: Because as it is, the Ghanaians have their own version of Pidgin, Nigerians have their own version of Pidgin, the people at Cotonou have theirs too.
Text_ortho: Because as e be like dis, di people for Ghana get deir own Pidgin, people for Nigeria get deir own Pidgin, people for, for Cotonou get deir own.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because as it is, the people in Ghana have their own Pidgin, people in Nigeria have their own Pidgin, people in, in Cotonou have their own Pidgin.

Text_en: You know, in the different countries... in the West African countries, they have their own different versions of Pidgin.
Text_ortho: You know, for different countries, for West African countries, de get deir own different kind of, of Pidgin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, in different countries, in West African countries, there are different kinds of... of Pidgin Pidgin.

Text_en: So we know that with time, it'll grow.
Text_ortho: So we know sey with time, e dey grow.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So we know that in time it is growing.

Text_en: With time, it, it, it's growing.
Text_ortho: With time, e, e, e dey grow.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: In time it... it... it... it... it is growing up.

Text_en: So, well, basically, as... with the shows I organize, which give me the opportunity to interact with people every day, which take me to events in order to interview them... it's mostly in Pidgin.
Text_ortho: So basically sha, as, as di shows wey I dey do, wey dey make me dey interact with people everyday, wey I dey go events dey interview dem, na mostly Pidgin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So basically, as, as the show I'm doing, which makes me interact with people everyday, which I'm attending events, is mostly in Pidgin English.

Text_en: Even if I have a white guy on the Red Carpet, I'll tell him, "hey man, we speak Pigdin here in Nigeria, will you like to try it?"
Text_ortho: Even if I see white man on top red carpet, I go tell am Baba, for Nigeria o, we dey speak Pidgin, you go fit try?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Even if I see a white man on a red carpet, I will tell him, "baba, in Nigeria, we speak Pidgin English, you can try?"

Text_en: He'll say, "let's do this, let's do this", and he'll try to speak the language as best he can because he himself wants to identify with the, the language.
Text_ortho: E go say ah let us do dis, let us do dis, and e go dey speak am di way e fit speak am because im sef wan identify with di, di language as e be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He will say, "ah, let's do this... let's do this, and he will speak it in the way he wants to speak it because he wants to know the, the language as it is."

Text_en: So that's, that’s the basic thing we, we do.
Text_ortho: So na, na di basic thing wey we dey, wey we dey do be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So that's... that's the basic thing we're... we're doing.

Text_en: Okay, ladies and gentlemen, don't let this turn into a quarrel.
Text_ortho: Okay ladies and gentlemen, make e no for bring quarrel.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ladies and gentlement, do not make trouble.

Text_en: Today is Monday, and uh... we're already moving to the different departmental behaviors.
Text_ortho: Today na Monday, and ehn we don dey move to di different departmental behaviour.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Today is Monday, and uh... we are moving to the different departmental behaviour.

Text_en: Uh... they say a bird in hand, is worth uh... so many b-... so many millions in the bush.
Text_ortho: Ehn de say a bird for hand, e worth ehn many b-... many millions for inside bush.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They say a bird is in the hand, it's worth uh... a lot of b-... many millions in the bush.

Text_en: But I'm saying that it's the bird in the hand that's the real bird.
Text_ortho: But I dey talk sey na di bird, na di bird wey de hold for hand na im be di real bird.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But I'm saying that the bird... the bird they hold in their hands is the real bird.

Text_en: To avoid stories that touch the heart, "I was there", and "I shall be there" are two different things.
Text_ortho: To avoid story that touch, I was dere, and I shall be dere are two different things.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was there to avoid stories that touched people, and I will be there for two different things.

Text_en: Are you with me?
Text_ortho: Are you with me?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Are you with me?

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: Frankly speaking, you see, uh... if, if you... when we... when we look like at life generally, we know that uh... someone is talking.
Text_ortho: Kalapotedly, you see, ehn if, if you, when we, when we look like at life generally, we know sey ehn one person dey yarn.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Calapotedly, you see uh... if, if you... when we... when we look at life generally, we know that uh... one person is talking.

Text_en: Your words, right, are different from people... other, other people's words.
Text_ortho: Your yarns ehn e dey different from people, oder, oder people's yarnings.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Your yarn uh... is different from people... other people's yarn.

Text_en: And if you... if you want to equate your words with other people's words, it'll drive you crazy.
Text_ortho: And if you, if you want to equate your yarn with oder people yarning, you go tear your shirt.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: And if you... if you want to associate your yarn with other people, you will tear your shirt.

Text_en: You alone will go crazy, you alone will be disgraced and you alone will destroy your authencity as a spoilt brat.
Text_ortho: Only you go throw yours away, only you go fall your hand, only you go tear your ajebo certificate.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You will throw your car away, you will only fall your hands, only you will tear your ajebo certificate.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na so e be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That is how it is.

Text_en: Don't let it turn into a quarrel.
Text_ortho: Make e no for bring quarrel at all, at all.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He should not bring trouble at all, at all.

Text_en: That's worse.
Text_ortho: Na im bad pass.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It's the worst.

Text_en: I was there and I shall be there are two different things.
Text_ortho: I was dere, and I shall be dere na two different things.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was there, and I will be there for two different things.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: My mom's tummy is big and my mother is pregnant are two different things, to avoid stories that touch the heart.
Text_ortho: My mama get belle, and my mother is pregnant na two different things to avoid story that touch.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Is my mom pregnant and my mother is pregnant? These are two different reasons to avoid stories that touch people.

Text_en: What it is, we don’t know yet.
Text_ortho: What it is, we never know yet.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Saying, "what it is... we never know."

Text_en: So that's how things stand.
Text_ortho: Ehn so na di matter be dis o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Uh... so, that's the matter.

Text_en: Well, the Professor has spoken.
Text_ortho: Ehn di prof don yarn.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Eh, the prophet has said it.

Text_en: The discussiont goes on.
Text_ortho: Yarnings continue.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Yarnites continued.

Text_en: In fact, what are we saying?
Text_ortho: Wetin we dey yarn sef?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: What are we saying?

Text_en: I don't even know.
Text_ortho: I no even know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I don't even know.

Text_en: I'm just speaking my mind.
Text_ortho: I just dey yarn my mind.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was just telling myself.

Text_en: You understand, I'm just baring my mind, you understand.
Text_ortho: You understand, I just dey tear my shirt you understand.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You understand, I am just tearing up my shirt, you understand.

Text_en: People are just looking at me and they're wondering what I'm talking about.
Text_ortho: People just dey look me dey wonder wetin I dey yarn.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: People were just watching me, wondering what I was saying.

Text_en: But all talk is about conversation.
Text_ortho: But all yarn na yarn.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But all the yarn is yarn.

Text_en: So as to not waste time, because if you say yours, I say mine.
Text_ortho: Make e no for loss because if you yarn your yarn, I yarn my yarn.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Don’t let it go for nothing because if you say your yarn, I'll tell you my own.

Text_en: All together, we call it a conversation.
Text_ortho: All together, we call it yarnings.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: All together, we call it yarning.

Text_en: Are you listening to me?
Text_ortho: Una dey hear me so?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Do you give ear to me?

Text_en: Many words are called multiple words.
Text_ortho: Many yarnings, dey call it multiple yarnings.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Many yarns... call it multiple yarns.

Text_en: That’s how it is.
Text_ortho: Na so e be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That is how it is.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: Um... uh... there's a saying goes "before you shoot a bird, will you get its mother to fly away?"
Text_ortho: Em ehn sey before you shoot bird, make im mama fly?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Em uh... before you shoot birds, let your mom fly?

Text_en: Just hold the mother and the child together, lock them somewhere and give them food to eat.
Text_ortho: Make kuku hold di mama, hold di bird together, lock dem for one place, give dem food to chop.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Take the mother's cypress and the bird together, and put them in a secret place, and give them food.

Text_en: They'll cooperate with you at once.
Text_ortho: De go answer you once.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They will answer you once.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: What do I want to say again?
Text_ortho: Wetin I wan talk again?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: What else will I say?

Text_en: Myself, I've forgotten.
Text_ortho: Me, I don forget o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I've forgotten.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Okay.

Text_en: I'm MC Abi.
Text_ortho: I be MC Abi.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm mstchew.

Text_en: I'm a comedian, and we are saying so many things uh... on the language issue.
Text_ortho: I be comedian, and we dey yarn many yarns ehn for di langua matter.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm a comedian, and we're talking about uh... the longua thing.

Text_en: Uh... we are... we have different ways of referring to our father.
Text_ortho: Ehn we dey, we get different words we dey call our papa.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Uh... we are... we have different words that we call our father.

Text_en: We call them 'pile', we call them uh... uh... 'pupsie', we call him 'old man'.
Text_ortho: We dey call dem pile, we dey call dem ehn ehn pupsie, we dey call am old man.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We call them a pile, we call them uh... uh... a pupsie, we call them an old man.

Text_en: So one day, we got together and were praying for God to bless me!
Text_ortho: Na so one day, we come gather ourself together, come dey go pray sey make God bless me!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So one day, we got together and went to pray for God to bless me.

Text_en: It was, "God bless me."
Text_ortho: Na God bless me.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He blesses me.

Text_en: So I was praying for God to change my life!
Text_ortho: I con dey go pray sey make God change my life!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I was going to pray for God to change my life!

Text_en: And eventually, God changed my life!
Text_ortho: Naim God change my life o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So God changed my life!

Text_en: My brother, then my prayer changed.
Text_ortho: My brother, my prayer con change.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: My brother, my prayer changed.

Text_en: I got to the house and I was praying, "Father, crucify my old man... crucify my old man."
Text_ortho: I reach house con dey pray o Father, crucify my old man, crucify my old man.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I got to the house and was praying, "My Father, crucify my old man, crucify my old man."

Text_en: That was how I prayed.
Text_ortho: Na prayer wey I dey pray o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It's prayer I am praying for.

Text_en: I didn't know that I was ta-... talking about my own flesh.
Text_ortho: I no know sey na my flesh I dey ta-... talk about.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I don’t know that it's my flesh I am talking about.

Text_en: But my father heard me praying, and he thought I was talking about him.
Text_ortho: But my pile con hear di prayer, con think sey na im I dey talk about.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But my pile heard the prayer and thought I was talking about it.

Text_en: "Crucify my old man... crucify my old man."
Text_ortho: Crucify my old man, crucify my old man.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I am tired of my old man, I am tired of my old man.

Text_en: And so my pi-... my dad took his gun.
Text_ortho: Naim my pi-... pile carry gun o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So my pi-... pile of piles of gunmen.

Text_en: He pointed the gun at me saying, "You want to kill me, but instead, I'll be the first person to kill you in this town."
Text_ortho: Face me say na me you wan kill, instead of you to kill me, na me go kill you first for dis town.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Face me and say, "it's me you want to kill, instead of you to kill me, I'll kill you first in this town."

Text_en: My brother, I spent two weeks in the hospital, with POP [Plaster of Paris] on my neck.
Text_ortho: My brother, two weeks now I use for hospital with pop for my neck.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: My brother, for two weeks now, I was in the hospital with a pop on my neck.

Text_en: Limit my diction, limit my...
Text_ortho: Limit my diction, limit my...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I can limit my diction, limit my...

Text_en: Furthermore, my, my speech became really distorted.
Text_ortho: Further, my, my diction was frustrated to di core.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Further, my... my diction was tiring to the core.

Text_en: So, I was like that, and I let the issue rest.
Text_ortho: So na so I con be, I con comot for dat level.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So that was how I was... I left at that level.

Text_en: Then, I graduated to the next point of expressional dimensional overture.
Text_ortho: I con graduate to di next point of expressional dimensional overture.
