EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then I graduated to the next point of expressional dimensional overture.

Text_en: What did I say?
Text_ortho: Wetin I talk?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: What did I say?

Text_en: I don't know yet.
Text_ortho: I never know yet.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I haven't known.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na so e be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That is how it is.

Text_en: I'm hustling, that's it.
Text_ortho: I dey hustle, na im be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm working hard, that's that.

Text_en: MC Abi, that's my name, do not forget.
Text_ortho: Mc Abi, dat my name, make e no for loss.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Mstchew, let my name be for ever.

Text_en: I'm here for your sake.
Text_ortho: I dey hear for una.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I have had word of it for you.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: Okay, the show I'm featuring on here is tagged, "On a Lighter Note with MC Abi."
Text_ortho: Okay di show wey I dey do for here na On a Lighter Note with MC Abi.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Okay, the show I do here is On a Lighter Note with MC Abi.

Text_en: We're talking about so many things happening in society from uh... or from different perspectives.
Text_ortho: We dey talk about many things wey dey happen for di society ehn from, ehn or from different perspective.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We're talking about many things happening in the society uh... from, uh... from different perspectives.

Text_en: We're looking at life from the funny angles so that people won't be depressed.
Text_ortho: We dey look life from di funny angle so dat people no go just dey serious.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We are looking at life from the funny angle so people won't be serious.

Text_en: You're always walking about with your arms up as if your have boils in your armpits.
Text_ortho: Everytime, you just dey waka dey carry hand for up as sey e get boil for armpit.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You are going up and up, like a boil in the armpit.

Text_en: You know, your... you will calm down.
Text_ortho: You know, your, you will calm down.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, your... you will calm down.

Text_en: You won't...
Text_ortho: You no go...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You won't...

Text_en: You know, you won't just squeeze your face like... as if your look reminds people of scarcity or austerity, or that people are on strike.
Text_ortho: You no, you no go just dey squeeze your face like, as if sey your face dey remind people sey scarcity dey, or austerity dey, or people dey on strike.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You won't... you won't just squeeze your face like, as if your face reminds people that there is no scarcity, or violence, or people are on strike.

Text_en: No!
Text_ortho: No!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: No!

Text_en: We want us to be... everyone to calm down.
Text_ortho: Wan meh we, everybody dey calm down.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Let's make everybody calm down.

Text_en: There's enough problems around already.
Text_ortho: Di weather don hot enough.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The weather is hot.

Text_en: If you're having hot pepper soup while the weather is hot, you just want to make things worse.
Text_ortho: If weather hot, you con dey go drink hot pepper soup for dis hot weather, na hot temper you wan dey, you wan get last, last.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If the weather is hot, you will go and drink hot pepper in this hot weather, it's a hot temper you want to get, you want to get last.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: So what?
Text_ortho: So what?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So what?

Text_en: Everybody is trying to calm down, enjoy the groove, and enjoy what we are saying.
Text_ortho: Everybody dey calm down, dey enjoy di groove, dey enjoy our yarnings.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Everyone calms down, enjoys the groove, enjoys our yarn.

Text_en: We talk about lots of things: fashion, life, general trending issues (you know), post... plus political matters... everything, you know.
Text_ortho: We talk about many things (fashion, life, trends), things wey dey happen generally (you know), post, plus political matter, everyting you know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We talk about many things (fashion, life, trends), things happening generally (you know), post, and politics, everything you know.

Text_en: We're just talking about it all.
Text_ortho: We just dey talk about am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We're just talking about it.

Text_en: So those are the things we talk about on the show known as "On a Lighter Note with MC Abi" and every day comes with its own gist.
Text_ortho: So naim we dey yarn for On a Lighter Note with MC Abi, and every day get im own gist.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So that's what we're saying in On a Lighter Note with MC Abi every day.

Text_en: For example, today is Proverbial, Proverbial Monday.
Text_ortho: Like today na proverbial, proverbial Monday.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Today is a proverbial, proverbial Monday.

Text_en: We talk about different proverbs, explaining them with real life issues.
Text_ortho: We talk about different proverbs, push different hole to the matter.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We talk about different proverbs, try different holes in the matter.

Text_en: We will tell you a proverb when people are...
Text_ortho: We go tell you one proverb wen people dey...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We will tell you a proverb when people...

Text_en: When you hear it, naturaly, it is... it has a meaning, but we attach humor to it.
Text_ortho: Wen you hear am, naturally, e be, e get im meaning o, but we dey attach our own humour into it.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: When you hear it, naturally, it's... it has a meaning, but we attach our own humour into it.

Text_en: But they'll tell you that the downfall of a man is not the... not... it's not the end of his life.
Text_ortho: But de go tell you sey di downfall of a man, e say e no be di, not, it's not di end of his life.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But they will tell you that the fall of a man, it's not the, not, it's the end of his life.

Text_en: I say it's a lie.
Text_ortho: I say na lie!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say it's a lie!

Text_en: It depends on where the man falls from.
Text_ortho: It depends on where di man fall from.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It depends on where the man comes from.

Text_en: Yes, because if the man falls from a tall... a very high building, and hits the ground, that means he's dead.
Text_ortho: Ehn because di man fall from one tall, one very high building, fall for ground, e don die be dat.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehn, because the man fell from one tall building, one very high building, falling to the ground, he had died.

Text_en: That's... that's also known as "Call to Glory."
Text_ortho: Dat dey, de dey call call to glory.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That's... they call it glory.

Text_en: You are on your own, by yourself and with yourself.
Text_ortho: You are on your own, by yourself, with yourself.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You are on your own, by yourself, by yourself.

Text_en: Yes, and on Tuesdays, we do trendy things, those things in vogue, you know, the things going on in town, in your neighborhood (you know), what's the... what, what happens to be the new thing, the new level... the rave of the moment.
Text_ortho: Ehen so Tuesdays, we dey do trendy things, wetin dey reign, wetin dey (you know), wetin dey happen for di town, for your area (you know), wetin be, wetin, wetin be di new gist, di new level wey, wey de dey do for your side.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Uhuh, so Tuesdays, we're into the latest trends, what's happening, what's happening in the town... in your area... you know, what's... what's new, what's new, what's the new, what's the new, what's the new, what's the new, what's the new, what's the new, what's the new, which they're doing on your side.

Text_en: Then on Wednesdays, we talk about relationships, love matters, you know, you know...
Text_ortho: Den Wednesday, we talk about relationship, wit love matter you know you know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: On Wednesday, we discussed the relationship... with love matter, you know.

Text_en: You know, this issue of "I love you, I love you."
Text_ortho: You know, dis I love you, I love you.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, this I love you... I love you.

Text_en: It looks... it’s turning into something else.
Text_ortho: E get, e get how e wan dey be.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: There's... there's a way he wants to be.

Text_en: The last time I was told that... when a chick told me, "okay, if you know you really love me, would you die for me?", I warned her.
Text_ortho: Last time wey de tell me sey, wen one babe tell me sey ehen if you know you really love me, can you die for me, na me warn am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Last time they told me that... when one girl told me that uhuh, if you really love me, you can die for me, I'm the one to warn him.

Text_en: I said, "if you try it with me!"
Text_ortho: I say if you try am!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I say, if you try it!

Text_en: "How will I die for you?"
Text_ortho: How I go take die for you?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: How may I give you my life for you?

Text_en: "Don't you know that the love I have for you is an undying love?"
Text_ortho: You no know sey the love I have for you is an undying love?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Do you not see that the love I have for you is a love which goes deeper than any other love?

Text_en: That's my escape route.
Text_ortho: Na dere I take escape.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was where I got away.

Text_en: Because I can't die for anyone.
Text_ortho: Because I no fit die for anybody.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Because I can't die for anybody.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen!

Text_en: So on Wednesdays... I mean Thursdays, we talk about past events which happened many years ago, in those days when we were... when we were really living, and we compare it to what we have now.
Text_ortho: So Wednesdays, abi Thursday we talk about the things wey don happen before, many years ago, in dose days when we dey, when we dey live life den, compare am to wetin dey happen now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So Wednesdays, or Thursdays, we will talk about things which have happened before... in those days when we were... when we were living and then compare them with what is happening now.

Text_en: Like the poems we recite in those days, when we were in school; our poems are different from what they have now.
Text_ortho: Like di poems wey de dey sing in dose days when we dey school, our poems different wit poems de sing now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Like the poems that were singing in those days when we were in school, our poems are different with our own.

Text_en: We recited poems like 'your canoe is out of shape, our canoe is in shape...'
Text_ortho: We sing poem like una canoe bend, bend, our canoe go straight.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We made a song like your canoes, our canoes are straight.

Text_en: Those were the kinds of poem we used to sing.
Text_ortho: Na dose kind poem we dey sing.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We sing those kinds of songs.

Text_en: You know, a bonga, a bonga... we don't know it.
Text_ortho: You know a bonga, a bonga, we no sabi am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know a banga, a banga, we don't know.

Text_en: But nowadays, all those children... their... the package... it doesn’t work out well.
Text_ortho: But nowadays, all dose children, deir, di package, e no dey do.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: But nowadays, all those children, their... the packaging doesn't do that.

Text_en: So we do... we compare the things of those days with the things of, of... (you know), now... nowadays.
Text_ortho: So we dey, we dey compare things of dose days, and things of, of (you know) now, nowadays.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So we are... we are comparing things of those days and things of... (you know) now, nowadays.

Text_en: How we go to school in those days... we put our slates under our armpits, we take...
Text_ortho: How we dey go school dat time, we dey carry slate for armpit, we dey carry...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: How we went to school that time, we were carrying slate on the armpit, we were carrying...

Text_en: Our slates were our... they were our modern-day day iPad, or tablet that we use now.
Text_ortho: Our slates, na im be our, na im be our present Ipad, or tab wen una dey use now.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Our slate, it's our... it's our present iPad you use now.

Text_en: It's the slate.
Text_ortho: Na slate.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: It's a slate.

Text_en: We call it a blackboard.
Text_ortho: We dey call am blackboard.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We call it blackboard.

Text_en: A small one.
Text_ortho: Small one.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Small one.

Text_en: We wrote our ABCs and 123s on them.
Text_ortho: Dey write a b c, and one two three put.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Writing a b c, and one and two.

Text_en: We held them under our armpits and took them to school.
Text_ortho: We hold am for armpit, carry am go school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We took him by the armpit, and took him to school.

Text_en: You know, we went schools for the sake of eating akara [bean cake] at that time.
Text_ortho: You know, we dey go akara school dat time.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, we used to go to akara school that time.

Text_en: That's the nursery schoool.
Text_ortho: Na im be nursery school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He's a nursery school.

Text_en: You know, different things.
Text_ortho: You know different matter.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know different things.

Text_en: We took water bottles with us.
Text_ortho: We come carry water bottle for body.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We brought a water bottle for our body.

Text_en: All of us will drink with the same cup, from a big drum, at the long break period.
Text_ortho: All of us go use only one cup for one big drum take dey drink water for, during long break.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: All of us are to take up a cup in a great vessel for drinking water.

Text_en: No.
Text_ortho: No.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Nov.

Text_en: For those long...
Text_ortho: For dose long...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For those long...

Text_en: Then we'd go... we'd drop one kobo each into a bowl to eat bread and akara.
Text_ortho: We go come go, we go come drop one, one kobo for bowl to chop bread, and akara.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We will go, we will drop one kobo on the bowl to eat bread and akara.

Text_en: That was how we hustled back then.
Text_ortho: Na so we take hustle o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was how we hustled.

Text_en: I was in school at that time.
Text_ortho: Na so I dey school dat time.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was how I was at school that time.

Text_en: Then, l was asked to read the letters of the alphabet.
Text_ortho: De come tell me sey make I read A B C.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then they asked me to read A B C.

Text_en: I sang the ABCs.
Text_ortho: I come dey sing am A B C D E F G H.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I sang it A B C D E F G H.

Text_en: Then I got to a part in the song...
Text_ortho: I come reach one place.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then I got to a place.

Text_en: M U M E O P.
Text_ortho: M U M E O P.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: M U M E O P.

Text_en: Ah, that was how I understood it.
Text_ortho: Ah na di way I understand am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ah, that's the way I understand it.

Text_en: So I took spu-... that was how I recited it.
Text_ortho: Naim I take spu-... naim I take speak am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Then I took spu-... that's when I spoke about it.

Text_en: I said M U M E scopew.
Text_ortho: I say M U M E scope U.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said M U M E scope U.

Text_en: U R O skecity.
Text_ortho: U R O scarcity.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: U R O.

Text_en: I said, "stop there!"
Text_ortho: I say stop dere!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said stop there!

Text_en: "Come and touch scopew on the board!"
Text_ortho: Come and touch scopew for board!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Take a look at the scope on the frame!

Text_en: I told the teacher that I was f-... I was sick.
Text_ortho: I say teacher, I dey f-... I dey sick.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I said, "teacher, I f-... I'm sick."

Text_en: Mama said if I'm sick, I shouldn't touch anything on the board.
Text_ortho: Mama say if I dey sick, meh I no dey touch anything for board.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Mama said if I'm sick, I shouldn't touch anything on the board.

Text_en: That was how I escaped in school.
Text_ortho: Na so I take escape for school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was how I got away from school.

Text_en: There were different things which helped in training us in schools.
Text_ortho: Different tings wey dey train for school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Different things that are being taught at school.

Text_en: Confusion.
Text_ortho: Confusion.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Confusion.

Text_en: Confusion.
Text_ortho: Confusion.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Confusion.

Text_en: The teacher gave me math and English exercises.
Text_ortho: Teacher give me maths, and English.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The teacher taught me matematica and English.

Text_en: I failed.
Text_ortho: I fail am.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I failed him.

Text_en: I was provoked, and I went out to call my 'mile'.
Text_ortho: I provoke, go call my mile.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I provoke, go and call my mile.

Text_en: Mile is another name for mom in Warri.
Text_ortho: Mile na name wey we dey call our mama for Warri.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Mile is a name we call our mother in Warri.

Text_en: I went out to call my mom, and I told her, "come and see!"
Text_ortho: I go call my mile, con say mile, come see o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I will call my mom and say, "my mom, come and see!"

Text_en: Out of all the students in this school, they beat me saying that I don’t understand math and English.
Text_ortho: For dis full school, de beat me say I no know maths and English.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: At this school, they beat me because I didn't know math or English.

Text_en: My mom showed up.
Text_ortho: My mile show.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: My mile show.

Text_en: A typical Urhobo woman.
Text_ortho: Typical Urhobo woman.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Typical Urhobo woman.

Text_en: She warned the teacher.
Text_ortho: E warn di teacher.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He warned the teacher.

Text_en: "Teacher, you whipped my child."
Text_ortho: Teacher, you flog my pikin.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Teacher, you flog my child.

Text_en: He said yes.
Text_ortho: E say yes.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said yes.

Text_en: Uhuh?
Text_ortho: Ehen?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Ehen?

Text_en: She said "okay, why did you whip him?"
Text_ortho: Sey okay, why you flog am?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Saying, "okay, why are you flog him?"

Text_en: The teacher said, "because I gave him exercises in math and English, and he failed."
Text_ortho: E say because I give am maths, and English, e fail.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said because I taught him matematica and English, he failed.

Text_en: The teacher said...
Text_ortho: Teacher say...
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The Teacher said...

Text_en: My mom said, "do you even understand math?"
Text_ortho: My mama say you sef, you sabi maths?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: My mother said, "you know math too?"

Text_en: The teacher said, "of course, I'm the teacher."
Text_ortho: Teacher say of course na me be teacher.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The teacher said, "well, I'm the teacher."

Text_en: My mum said "okay, if you understand math, then solve this one for me."
Text_ortho: Sey okay if you sabi maths, solve dis maths for me!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Okay, if you know math, solve math for me!

Text_en: Mom mom gave the teacher a tough math exercise.
Text_ortho: Mama con give teacher tough mathematics.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Mama gave a teacher hard math.

Text_en: She said okay!
Text_ortho: E say okay!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: He said okay!

Text_en: Some went to this place and some went to the other place.
Text_ortho: Some go dis place, and some go di oda place.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Some will go to this place and some will go to the other place.

Text_en: How many remained?
Text_ortho: How many go remain?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Whose people will remain?

Text_en: For two minutes, the teacher was confused.
Text_ortho: For two minutes, teacher confuse.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For two minutes, the teacher was confused.

Text_en: The teacher said, "lady, this isn't math."
Text_ortho: Say mama, dat no be mathematics!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Say mom, that's math!

Text_en: My mum said, "come on, keep quiet!"
Text_ortho: Mama say come on, keep quiet!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Mama said come on, keep quiet!

Text_en: "You don't know that this is a simple math exercise."
Text_ortho: You no know sey simple maths now be dis.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You don’t know that these are simplified maths.

Text_en: "If some went to this place, and some went another other place, only some will remain?"
Text_ortho: If some go dis place, and some go di oda place, na some go remain?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If some go to this place, and some go to the other place, will there be some of them?

Text_en: Oh boy!
Text_ortho: Oh boy!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Oh boy!

Text_en: For, for the next five uh... four years in school, the, the teacher didn't lay a finger on me.
Text_ortho: For, for di next five, ehn four years for school, teacher no touch me o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: For, for the next five uh... four years in school, the teachers didn't touch me.

Text_en: If you dare raise a cane up to beat me, I'll just say that I'll get my mom to come after you.
Text_ortho: If you just raise cane up like dis, I go say I go call mama for you o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If you raise cane like this, I will say I will call Mama for you!

Text_en: I threatened the whole school with the news of my mom coming.
Text_ortho: I use my mama threaten di full school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I used my mom to threaten the entire school.

Text_en: That was how I continued till I left... finished my primary school education.
Text_ortho: Na so I take comot, take finish my primary school.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: That was how I left, finished my primary school.

Text_en: So don't forget that.
Text_ortho: So make e no for loss.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So let it not be for nothing.

Text_en: (You know), we picked different things from our neighborhood.
Text_ortho: (You know), area don develop us.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know, the area has developed.

Text_en: Neighborhood... our neighborhood raised us.
Text_ortho: Area, area don arrange us.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: We have a lot of areas.

Text_en: You know that a frog's eye... you get things done because you're smart.
Text_ortho: You know sey Okpolo eye, you chop because you get big head.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You know that Ochpolo eye, you ate because you have a big head.

Text_en: Not because you are the general overseer.
Text_ortho: No be sey you be general overseer.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You're not the general overseer.

Text_en: You don't understand?
Text_ortho: You no understand?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You don't understand?

Text_en: Uh... people say that the monkey got smart because the trees are closely connected.
Text_ortho: Ehn de say na because tree near tree na im make monkey dey smart.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: They say it's because a tree near a tree makes the monkeys get smart.

Text_en: If the trees are far apart, you'll see that monkeys will go under, buy pure water, board a motorcycle, and use a handkerchief because the weather is hot [meaning that the monkey will apply wisdom].
Text_ortho: If tree far from each other, you go see monkey go jump under, go buy pure water, go enter okada, use handkerchief because weather hot.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: If a tree is far away from one another, you will see monkeys jumping under, buy pure water, enter into a ditch because the weather is hot.

Text_en: Do you understand?
Text_ortho: You understand?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: You understand?

Text_en: Don't let it cause a quarrel, my brothers and sisters, understand!
Text_ortho: So make e no bring quarrel my brother, and sisters ehen!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: So don’t make trouble with my brother and sisters, uhuh!

Text_en: That means I have been speaking with you.
Text_ortho: Na im be sey I be dey yarn with una o.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I'm saying these things to you.

Text_en: The conversation continues.
Text_ortho: Di yarnings still continue.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: The yarning continues.

Text_en: Kanapotelli zaga za.
Text_ortho: Kanapotelli zaga za.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Kanapotelli zaga za.

Text_en: What does that mean?
Text_ortho: Wetin e mean?
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: What does it mean?

Text_en: I dunno.
Text_ortho: I no know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I don't know.

Text_en: I don't even want to know.
Text_ortho: I no even wan know.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: I don't even want to know.

Text_en: Get out!
Text_ortho: Get out!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Get out!

Text_en: Your father!
Text_ortho: Your father!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Your father!

Text_en: "Your father" is a greeting.
Text_ortho: Your father na greeting.
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Your father is a greeting.

Text_en: It's not a curse!
Text_ortho: No be curse o!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Let's not curse you!

Text_en: Thank you!
Text_ortho: Thank you!
EnglishTranslationPCMWithoutDEVTest: Thank you!
